New Records: The Pacers set the record for the lowest number combination ever for one team in an NBA game with Tyrese Haliburton, Bennedict Mathurin, Andrew Nembhard, Thomas Bryant, and Obi Toppin on the floor
Key Match Events: The Pacers beat the Chicago Bulls 129-113, their fourth win in a row and tenth win in their last 13 games
Post-Match Reflections: Thomas Bryant played his best game with the Pacers so far this year, scoring 22 points and grabbing eight rebounds
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers are now up to sixth in the Eastern Conference standings, and are waiting for Aaron Nesmith to return from his injury
Others: The Pacers may look to make a move at the trade deadline to address their need for help off the bench and a bigger wing
